div.ab1: cašm andar esm wa buy konišn imąm. aēsmanąsca. baōδīmca. cašm andar ātaxš konišn tauua āθrō...
He should gaze at the esm and buy and (recite) imąm. aēsmanąsca. baōδīmca. . He should gaze at the fire and (recite) tauua. āθrō. ...
sukure wa hum *pālā (bālā) ō ruy-e sang-e urwis nahādan
He has to put the sukure and the hum-pālā on the stone of the urwis.
dast-e rāst bordan wa daste-ye hāwan dar hāwan zadan hāwan škāftan wa bar dāštan āwardan-e ō dast-e rāst-e zud bar ruy-e sang-e urwis sar nagān kardan daste durtar ruy-e sang-urwis nahādan

He has to near the right hand and hit the pestle against the hāwan. He has to strike the hāwan and raise it and bring it to the right hand of the zud. He has to put it on the stone of the urwis and put the pestle as well on the stone of the urwis, but further.
neke-ye ruz wa māh har ruz ke bāšad az urmazd tā anirān neke-ye ān ruz beguyand har māh ke bāšad neke-ye ān māh begyuand tā sar
the day and the month. He has to say the corresponding day, from Urzmazd to Anirān. He has to say the corresponding month until the end
hāwan-e rāst be zanišn
He should turn the hāwan right side.
hum wa urwarān andar hāwan nahādan
He should put the hum and the urwarān into the hāwan.
esm wa buy yektā ke nahāde ba ruy-e ātaš nahišn
He should put a piece of esm and buy on the fire
aētaṯ.dəm vīspanąm daste-ye hāwan az ruy-e sang-e urwis be-dast gereftan
At aētaṯ.dəm vīspanąm he should take the pestle from the stone of the urwiswith the hand.

čašm wa ruy andar wāxtar afšānidan snaϑāi. aŋhrahe. mainiiə̄uš. druuatō. yaʾni zanišn b-ahreman druwand snaθāi aešmahe xruuī.draōš čašm wa ruy andar awāxtar afšānidan yaʾni zanišn be-hišm xore dir zaxš diw dādan snaθāi mazaniianąm daēuuanąm čašm wa ruy andar awāxtar afšānidan yaʾni zanišn be mazanegān diwān dãdan snaθāi vīspanąm daēuuanąm čašm wa ruy andar awāxtar afšānidan yaʾni zanišn bā hamān diwān dādan varənīnąmca druuatąm daste az ruy-e sang-urwis bar dāštan se bār bar se sān hāwan zadan yekbār az ānsu ke xoršid bar-āyad yeki az ānsuy-e nimruz yeki az ānsuy ke xoršid foru sšawad pas daste bar dast negāh dāštan

At snaϑāi. aŋhrahe. mainiiə̄uš. druuatō. he has to turn the eyes and the face towards the west, that means, he has to hit the lying Ahreman. At snaθāi aešmahe xruuī.draōš he has to turn the eyes and the face towards the west, that means, he has to hit the diwhišm .. .(?). At snaθāi mazaniianąm daēuuanąm he has to turn the eyes and the face towards the west, that means, he has to hit the diw mazanegān. At snaθāi vīspanąm daēuuanąm he has to turn the eyes and the face towards the west, that means, he has to hit all the diw. At varənīnąmca druuatąm he has to raise the pestle from the stone of the urwis and to strike the hāwan three times in three different ways: once in the direction in which the sun rises; once, in the south direction and once in the direction in which the sun goes down.Afterwards, he gazes at the pestle in the hand.
daste čahār angušt bālā bordan yaʾni bozorg dāram ormazd riyōmand xorremand rā
He has to raise the pestle four fingers, that is, I make great Urzmazd, the rich and glorious.
čahār angušt digar daste bālā bordan yaʾni bozorg dāram amešāsfandān rā
He has to raise the pestle another four fingers, that is, I make great the Amešāsfandān.
čahār angušt digar daste bālātar bar dãštan yaʾni bozorg dāram tštar setar urmazd-dād
He has to raise the pestle another four fingers, that is, I make great the star Tištar, created by Urmazd.
daste-ye hāwand čahār angušt digar bālātar dāštan yaʾni bozorg dāram amešāsfandān hamā-ye minuān wa hamā-ye ašuān pas daste forud āwardan se bār ruy-e hāwan gardānidan mšl (?) ke xoršid mi-gardad

He has to raise the pestle another four fingers, that is, I make great the Amešāsfandān, all the immaterial and the material ones. Afterwards, he has to put down the pestleand turn it three tiomes in the hāwan in the direction in which the sun goes.

pas čahār yaθā ahū vairiiō xāndan yaθā ahū vairiiō awwal xāndan tā š́iiaoθananąm yekbār hum [wa] urwarān kuftan aŋhə̄uš yekbār kuftan mazdā̊ yekbār kuftan xšaθrəmca ahurāi ā. yim. darəɤubiiō vāstārəm xāndan čahār angušt daste az hāwan ǧodā kardan pas yaθā ahū vairiiō dowwom be š́iiaoθnanąm do bār kuftan aŋhə̄uš do bār kuftan mazdā do bār kuftan xšaθrəmcā tā sar xāndan yaθā ahū vairiiō seiwom be š́iiaoθnanąm se bār kuftan be aŋhə̄uš se bār kuftan wa se bār kuftan xšaθrəmcā tā sar xāndan yaθā ahū vairiiō čahārom tā vāstārəm *hum (hāwan) kuftan wa hāwan škāftan

Afterwards, he has to recite four yaθā ahū vairiiō . He has to recite the first yaθā ahū vairiiō until š́iiaoθananąm and pound once the hum and the urwarām; at aŋhə̄uš he has to pound once; at mazdā̊ he has to pound once and then to recite xšaθrəmca ahurāi ā. yim. darəɤubiiō vāstārəm. He has to move the pestle four fingers off from the mortar. Then, (he has to recite ) the second yaθā ahū vairiiō . At š́iiaoθananąm, he has to pound two times; at aŋhə̄uš , he has to pound two times; at mazdā̊ , he has to pound two times and then to recite until the end. In the third yaθā ahū vairiiō , at š́iiaoθananąm, he has to pound three times; at aŋhə̄uš , he has to pound three times; at mazdā̊ he has to pound three times and then to recite it until the end. During the fourth yaθā ahū vairiiō until vāstārəm, he has to pound the hum and strike the mortar.
in wačast čahār bār xāndan hum wa urwarān andar hāwan kuftan
He has to recite this stanza four times and to pound the hum and the urwarān in the hāwan.
in wacašt čahār bār xāndan har yek bār hum wa urwarām kuftan hāwan škāftan
He has to recite this stanza four times and to pound the hum and the urwarān and hit the hāwan.
se bār xāndan har yek aṣ̌əm vohū yek bār zur andar hāwan rixtan
He has to recite it three times and at each aṣ̌əm vohū he has to pour zur in the hāwan.
aθāwa daste-ye hāwan čonke xoršid gardad wa se bār gardeš zī.nə̄. humāiiō. tarā̊ŋhnəm.
At aθā he has to turn the pestle three times (around the hāwan in the direction in which the sun rotates (and to continue with) zī.nə̄. humāiiō. tarā̊ŋhnəm..
hum wa urwarān kufte andar sar-e daste-ye hāwan nahādan wa bordan be-suy-e čab-e barsom nahādan
He has to put the hum and urwarān that have been pounded in the end of the pestle and bring it and put it in the left side of the barsom.
yaθā ahū vairiiō čahār bār xāndan wa hum wa urwarān kuftan b-āb-e zur andar kardan wa hum pyāle kardan be yaθā ahū vairiiō har čahār yaθā ahū vairiiō hamčenin bāyad kard

He has to recite the Ahuna Vairiia four times and pound the hum and the urwarān und put them into the zur-water and in the hum-cup (pyāle). At any of the four Ahuna Vairiia he has to repeat it in the same way.
sraotā.mōi. mərəždātā.mōi. hum wa urwarān *āšordan
At sraotā.mōi. mərəždātā.mōi. he has to press the hum and the urwarān

har se bār xāndan pas dast andar hāwan nahādan ān sukure-e farāhum be-ruy-e hāwan-e daste nahādan wa ān sukure ke šeib-e hum pyāle nahāde ast ke-š farāhum andar-ast be-dast-e rāst bar dāštan yek qaṯre be-sukure ruy-e hāwan kardan bāqi andar farāhum-dān kardan digar yek qaṯre be sukure-ye pas farāhum-dān kardan

He has to recite this stanza three times. Then he has to put the hand in the hāwan. The goblet (sukure) for the hum has to be put next to the pestle. He has to raise with the right hand the bowl (sukure) that is put below the hum-filter (pyāle) and in which the farāhum . He has to pour a drop into the bowl next to the hāwan and a bit into the farāhum-dān and another drop into the bowl (sukure) that is behind the farāhum-dān.

pas ān hum wa urwarān kufte andar guše-ye sang-e urwis nahādan waras andar hum pyāle gozāštan pas dast be-pādyāb bordan ān hum wa ān urwarām ke be-dast-e čab nahāde ast āwardan piš-e hum pyāle nahādan pas dast be-pādyāb bordan ān zur ke be-dast-e čab nahāde ast āwardan piš-e hum pyāle nahādan ān zur ke be-dast-e čab nahāde ast āwardan piš-e hum pyāle nahādan pas qatre-ye šir andar ǧām-dān rixtan az ān rixtan az ān naguftim inǧā imąmcā. gąm. jīuuiiąm. čon šir nabud pas be-dast-e čab barsom ke andar māhruy nahāde gereftan

Afterwards, he has to put the hum and urwarān that have been pressed in one corner of the stone of the urwis . He has to put the waras in the hum-filter. He has to wash his hands with padyāb and bring the hum and urwarān that have been put on the left hand before the hum-filter and put (them there). Then, he has to wash his hand with padyāb and bring the zur that have been put on the left hand before the hum-filter and put (it there). Then, he has to pour one drop of milk into the ǧām-dān: because of the pouring (into the ǧām-dān, but not the hum-dān) I omitted imąmcā. gąm. jīuuiiąm., because there was no milk. Then, he has to take with the left hand the barsom that was located on the māhruy.
andar dast-e čab ādišt šodan ādišt šostan
He has to go to the left sid of the ādišt and wash it.
aṣ̌əm vohū 3 xāndan ādišt šostan az čab tā rāst wa miyān-e ādišt šostan
He recites three times the Aṣ̌əm Vohū and has to clean the ādišt. He has to clean it from the left to the right and the middle of the ādišt.
pas ānke dast-e u bar barsom dārad yaθā. ahū. vairiiō. dō xāndan
Then, the one who holds his hand on the barsom has top recite two Ahuna Vairiia.
pas dast az barsom bar dāštan az pas sang-e urwis be-dar āmadan
Then, he has to take his hand away from the barsom and then to come inside from the stone of the urwis.
